snippet: A forested site where science and exploration overlapped in the discovery of numerous viruses is today a little patch of forest, but research into the Zika virus continues.
abstract: Zika Forest Journal; Zika virus was first discovered in 1940s in Uganda's Zika Forest, swampy area near Lake Victoria that is veritable petri dish of mosquito-borne infections; area has shrunk in face of expanding development and human population,but research at Uganda Virus Research Institute in nearby Entebbe continues.
lead_paragraph: A forested site where science and exploration overlapped in the discovery of numerous viruses is today a little patch of forest, but research into the Zika virus continues.

headline.print_headline: Revisiting the African Backcountry Where a Virus First Came to Light
headline.main: In a Remote Ugandan Lab, Encounters With the Zika Virus and Mosquitoes Decades Ago
